channel.title: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work
channel.description:
LootyTV - Glow: https://www.shazam.com/amp/track/536587545/glow
Sounds a lot like the Auxy Intro, right? I uploaded a video with an extended version of the Auxy Intro I made, giving credit to Auxy for the original soundtrack. But I got a copyright claim from YouTube saying that I used the song Glow by LootyTV. People in the replies have been saying that Glow is a ripoff of Auxy Intro, so I think @Auxy should handle this.

item.title: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
They’ve previously given explicit permission to use any parts of demos used in sound packs. I’d assume it’s the same for other demo songs that came with the app.

If in doubt, contact support using the link/address available in the app.

They never visit here any more, even if @ed.

Read full topic
item.source: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work

item.title: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work
item.dc:creator: icelight
item.description:
I mean I’m pretty sure Auxy would make an intro project knowing that people will remix and use it, so I don’t think they’d put copyright claims over it.

People may well make their own songs from it, and in this case, might put rights for those songs

item.source: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work

item.title: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
icelight:

The video on the App Store is indeed a remixed version of Austin Haga’s Sandcastle

Indeed. I checked Austin’ SC.

Imo, my comments still stands though. It’s a decent track, but primitive (and, imo, yes, a bit twee and cheesy) in a way that could make Auxy seem like it’s only suited to basic productions, rather than showing more of what Auxy is actually capable of.

Yes, I know Austin is considered one of the top tier Auxy users, but that piece is primitive (not in a good way for this way) even by his own standards. There are many Auxy tracks I’d consider as better suited at showcasing Auxy’s capabilities.

Not sure if Auxy have simply been using that for yonks and simply haven’t ever updated it. I’d say it’s time.

Read full topic

item.source: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work

item.title: LootyTV is claiming Auxy Intro as their own work
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Is the intro/demo piece on the store using only sounds from the free version?
Seems like the sounds used are from the Original pack, rather than anything from the last 6–7 years.

I was quite disappointed (though not surprised*) that the piece is so primitive and toy-like, and frankly, cheesy.

Auxy has limitations, but that demo clip is really underselling Auxy’s actual capabilities. Most people checking out that demo clip probably think it’s just a toy, with more serious music makers probably scrolling past Auxy.

It’s no wonder that the userbase skews heavily towards young/teenage users, who are likely getting into music production for the first time.

And it’s no wonder they’ve always seemed to struggle to make Auxy a standout, profitable app.

*(It really is staggering how many basic marketing things the Auxy team get wrong, Terrible, terrible management. They half-ar*e everything. Or they’re simply just catastrophically sh*t at their job. )

Read full topic
